variables.label: PHP execution time
variables.description: Maximum execution time of each script, in seconds

variables.label: File size upload limit
variables.description: It will override the default value for apache and php-fpm inside the container. Default size is 2M

variables.label: Memory limit
variables.description: It will override the default value for apache and php-fpm inside the container. Default size is 128M

variables.label: Query history (true/false)
variables.description: when set to true, enables storing SQL history When false, history is stored in the browser and is cleared when logging out

variables.label: Query history max
variables.description: Maximum number of queries to store in the history

variables.label: PHP My Admin Version Tag
variables.description: Check out their Docker page for the valid tags https://hub.docker.com/r/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/tags/

instructions.start:
PhpMyAdmin is the most popular web interface for MySQL & MariaDB. Simply install PhpMyAdmin and then select what database you want to connect to.
Enter your PhpMyAdmin Configuration parameters and click on next. It will take about a minute for the process to finish.
instructions.end: PhpMyAdmin is deployed and available as $$cap_appname. You can access it at http://$$cap_appname.$$cap_root_domain.

description: phpMyAdmin is a free software tool written in PHP, intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the Web. phpMyAdmin supports a wide range of operations on MySQL and MariaDB.
